title: How to Find Model Numbers on Nike Shoes

steps.title: Locate the tag inside your shoe.
steps.content: Locate the tag inside your shoe. All authentic Nike shoes have a tag sewn into them with their size, barcode and model number on it. You will recognize it most easily by the barcode . Look for it inside: [2] X Research source The tongue The heel The arch

steps.title: Find the model number on the tag.
steps.content: Find the model number on the tag. The model number of your shoes is typically located under the size and above the barcode on the tag. It will be a six digit number followed by a three digit number (Example: AQ3366--601).

steps.title: Find the model number on the box if the tag is missing.
steps.content: Find the model number on the box if the tag is missing. If you still have the box that your Nike shoes came in, the model number will be printed on them. Look for it on the sticker that also displays the barcode and size. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Visit a sneakers database.
steps.content: Visit a sneakers database. Because some Nikes become collectibles, there are several online databases in which you can search for your specific shoe. These databases should list the model number, alongside shoe’s “name” and picture.

steps.title: Identify the “line” your shoe belongs to.
steps.content: Identify the “line” your shoe belongs to. Nike has, to date, 25 different lines of shoes (Including “Air Force One” and “Nike Running”). Usually this “line” will be prominently displayed on the outside of the shoe, and sometimes includes the name of a famous athlete (i.e. “Nike LeBron"). [4] X Research source

steps.title: Search for your shoes' “line” in the database.
steps.content: Search for your shoes' “line” in the database. Typing your shoes' line into a collectors database should yield photos of every shoe from that line, labelled with the shoes' "names" and model numbers. Browse these photos to see if you find a match.

steps.title: Search for shoes like yours at a "secondary market" online retailer.
steps.content: Search for shoes like yours at a "secondary market" online retailer. A "secondary market" in this case is a site like eBay , where people can sell things second hand. If anyone is selling shoes like yours online, they should turn up with the model number listed beside an easily identifiable photo, when you search for: [5] X Research source Their "name" - Nike shoes have unofficial names, such as “Sweet Leather Classic” and “Dunk”. The year you bought them in. Their colour.

steps.title: Ask the seller for the model number if they do not already have it listed.
steps.content: Ask the seller for the model number if they do not already have it listed. Most retail sites give you the option of contacting sellers with questions about their products. If you find a shoe whose picture matches yours, without its model number listed, you may directly message the seller with an inquiry, and they will likely be able to tell you.

steps.title: Cross reference your model number.
steps.content: Cross reference your model number. When you believe you’ve found your model number, type it into an online search engine . If you have correctly identified your model number, the results should show other shoes like it, confirming you have found the correct number.
